solution_line_template: Noah earned ${price_large_painting}/large painting x {num_large_paintings_last_month} large paintings = $<<{price_large_painting}*{num_large_paintings_last_month}={sales_large_paintings_last_month}>>{sales_large_paintings_last_month} for the large paintings.

He also earned ${price_small_painting}/small painting x {num_small_paintings_last_month} small paintings = $<<{price_small_painting}*{num_small_paintings_last_month}={sales_small_paintings_last_month}>>{sales_small_paintings_last_month} for the small paintings.

His total sales last month were ${sales_large_paintings_last_month} + ${sales_small_paintings_last_month} = $<<{sales_large_paintings_last_month}+{sales_small_paintings_last_month}={total_sales_last_month}>>{total_sales_last_month}.
So, his sales this month are ${total_sales_last_month} x {multiplier_this_month} = $<<{total_sales_last_month}*{multiplier_this_month}={sales_this_month}>>{sales_this_month}.
